Oona managed to overpower and disfigure him then made her escape but was labeled as a heretic to be killed on sight. So, she then set out into Faerun as a Chronicler on a sojourn of discovery.

Araniel is the son of a powerful and respected sorcerer and a royal guard swordswoman who cannot use magic. He was the middle child of 6 children, three older brothers, one younger brother, and one younger sister. His three brothers, adept magic wielders themselves, were already employed as guardsmen. Araniel focused most on learning magic, but was also trained to become a soldier. He?s the same age as the prince, and because his parents are so high class he actually grew up being friends with the prince, who gave Araniel a lot of really expensive gifts, jewelry in particular. This sparked Araniel?s interest in precious stones, especially when his siblings started getting jealous of his friendship with the prince. It made him feel unique in his very large family. His parents were humble despite their high status and they disliked all the gifts, forcing Araniel to return them, but he kept a ring that remains a special token of his friendship with the prince. Years later, their land was brutally attacked and Araniel fought for the first time. In doing so, he watched his boyfriend and one of his older brothers die, and another get his arm cut off, which traumatized Araniel and made him realize he couldn?t be a soldier for the rest of his life. In confiding with his friend, the prince suggested Araniel become a royal precious stonesmith, Which Araniel was very enthusiastic about, and the prince introduced him to a local jeweler. There, Araniel began to neglect both his guardsman duties and magic studies to learn the art of jewelry making, which his parents eventually had to come to terms with when they realized how happy he was. He?s still technically just an apprentice stonesmith and technically still officially employed as a guardsman, but he periodically takes long expeditions to discover new precious stones/metals. Because he?s dabbled in so many skills, magic, fighting, and artisan, he?s trying to prove he can become truly proficient in one thing for the rest of his life, and he wants that one thing to be jewelry making.

Morwen was raised in the isolated Moon Elf city of Evereska. Her parents Carric and Enna, while present, were distant, more prone to wandering the streets of the city and engaging with the community, than spending time with their daughter. By the age of thirty she already felt the wanderlust that plagues her race and her parents apprenticed her to a venerable Bard, local, and a friend of the family, so as to learn his trade. Morwen showed little aptitude for music, though excelled at story telling, making even the most outrageous tales ring with truth. After ten years of learning, her Master unexpectedly died, (old age takes its toll even on Elves, eventually) leaving Morwen without a mentor, and with an incomplete bardic skill set.She returned to her parents’ home, heartbroken, lost, and still longing for the freedom that the walls of Evereska could never give her. Rather than find Morwen another mentor, Enna convinced Carric to allow Morwen to choose her own form of study, whether that meant continuing the Bard’s path, or another. Morwen was unsure, and after a few more years of general study she discovered a lesser deity that she had never been taught of before: Fenmarel Mestarine, the lesser deity of outcasts. In her research she found a connection to the deity, and discovered her own ways to give praise, seeking out lonely corners of the city, abandoned buildings and underground gambling circles that those yet to reach adulthood weren’t meant to see. She found a skill at hiding, at sneaking and sliding through shadows, unseen by many around her. It was only when she was caught that she found her true calling. Faleas Stagswift was his name, and he was also in the shadows. It was in the process of a planned assassination that Morwen got in his way, and rather than kill her for the inconvenience, he was convinced to teach her his ways. It wasn’t easy, and Morwen never was more grateful for the old Bard’s teaching than when she told Faleas her life’s story. The story was full of lies, of course, and by the time Morwen finished talking she had Faleas convinced that she was an orphan, escaped from a dangerous caretaker, and not only in dire need of his assistance, but also an apt learner for his skills. Morwen did not return to her family’s home except once, to retrieve what little belongings she felt were truly hers. Her parents were not home. She didn’t really wonder if they would miss her, and she felt, truly, that they wouldn’t really notice she had gone. Faleas didn’t so much raise her, as he did tolerate her presence and allow her to observe. She found a home in the taverns they circulated between, loving the smells of cooking meats and drunken gambling around her. She was nearly seventy by the time they first ventured from Evereska into the Vine Vale and the Greycloak Hills below, trading odds and ends and scraps of information for anything they could get. There weren’t many people in the surrounding hills, and they often ventured back into Evereska when supplies ran low, or opportunities for wealth waned. Throughout this time Morwen learned that, more than danger, Faleas traded in information, and that information could be the most dangerous tool of all. She vowed to never tell a truth about herself if she could help it, because if an enemy didn’t know you, they couldn’t beat you. Morwen learned more than a little skill with bow and blade through hunting in the hills, but Faleas never asked for her assistance in the messier of his contracts, nor did he allow her to follow him. It was on those nights alone that Morwen would consider her life, her choices, and what those would mean for her once she was old enough to leave.When she was nearing her ninetieth year she began running cons of her own, independent of Faleas and his contracts. She never lost the skills the old Bard taught her, and she found it was much easier to convince someone that she was worthy of trust, than to prove that worthiness with her actions. Disguises became her fare, and it was not uncommon for her to see how many times she could meet a single tavern patron in one night before they caught wind of the ruse. It was also around this time when they first starting hearing tales of a wanted man and his young apprentice, sought in connection with a dozen murders and two dozen burglaries, with descriptions eerily similar to that of Faleas and herself. Descriptions of her were always vague and quite often glaringly inaccurate, but it was the first time Morwen felt more fear than exhilaration when someone looked at them twice in a shady tavern. Faleas, much older and blindingly secure in his skills, didn’t fear their bounty and continued his work with a tiresome pace. Morwen did not know if he was losing his touch, or perhaps it was simply a string of bad luck, but shortly before her hundredth year, Faleas was arrested and immediately sentenced to prison. She never found out how long his sentence was determined to be, but from every bit of gossip she could gather, they never found Faleas’ mystery apprentice, and the man denied her very presence. On her own for the first time in her life, and nearing what most elves would consider “adulthood”, Morwen began to travel more extensively. Her cons didn’t work at every tavern, but she found it was easy to play a new role in every town, even without the hassle of disguising her face. She found entertainment and company in many a pub from Evereska’s surrounding hills, to the high moors, to the very outskirts of Waterdeep. One of the easiest cons, she learned, was what words to say to convince an attractive stranger to share your bed. She enjoyed the company of every person she conned this way, and though none knew her true name, she had to admit, she fell a little bit in love with each and every one. She felt as if there were infinite parts of her heart, already shattered from too much distance, that she left with each of her lovers, a memory of her presence being perhaps the only true thing about their time together. It didn’t bother her, but the idea that perhaps someone would demand more of her, pieces of her heart that she wasn’t willing to give, and that she would be unable to stop it, worried at the back of her mind. She continued this con, and many others, traveling far and wide across the Faerun countryside. She rarely used the same name twice, and never the name she was raised with. Each evening she offered prayers to Fenmarel Mestarine, and embraced the life of an outcast that she had chosen to live, and each morning she moved on, town to town, city to city. She did not live uncomfortably, and her skill with both secrecy and deception gave her a certain leg up in games of cards that relied on more than chance, allowing her to earn an income with very little of what a common man would consider “work”.  There were many romances that lasted more than a night, many lovers staying at her side for months or even years at a time. She loved them all, though did not mourn their choice to leave, respecting their freedom to travel and love as they wish, just as she would like to be respected. She encountered, laughed and fought and drank, with those of every race, including a fateful encounter with a drow, who strayed near the surface one night when Morwen was alone. The drow female was alone, looking paranoid and scared of the very moon in the sky, but not so evil as she had been raised to believe. They didn’t share a language, but in their brief exchange they found the word for Fenmarel Mestarine, the lone wolf, was the same, and they found a brief kinship in their worship. The drow, most likely having had her fill of the surface, retreated into the cave from whence she came, but Morwen left changed by the experience, and half wishing she had a reason to adventure into the underdark to see what she could learn. It is this life of adventure-- scam, travel, and entertainment, that Morwen has chosen for herself, and though she sometimes longs for more, a deeper purpose beyond her current learning, she’s content in her place.

Originally from a high-class city closed off from the rest of the world, Enleth was taught by her mother that knowledge can be found in vast libraries but trust cannot be found in people. Obsessed with knowledge she read all the books she could find in her great city until her graduation, and the day her mother went missing. Enleth searched the city for 20 years with no sign of her mother and so decided to move on to other ground in order to continue the search, only trouble is that when you leave the city you immediately forget how to find it again, she may never return. Enleth now uses her book smarts to work with a tag team of misfits in the wastelands but never truly stops looking for her mother.

Volston is a businessman and trickster, always pursuing a true Philosopher Stone to achieve greater wealth. When his Elven husband passed suddenly without any signs of sickness, Volston felt abandoned by his homeland diety. He now pursues deeper arcane secrets, pledging his talents between neutral gods of magic and neutral gods of trickery. His failures have made him vigil and steadfast. His greed compels him to outsmart and plot against more powerful foes.

Màiri was born in Kelness, a small Dwarven village centered around a sawmill and an iron mine. Like her father Grier and her older brother Harris, it was expected that she would work the sawmill when she was old enough. But the traces of magic that ran in her family surfaced at a young age. Grier, who thought magic was the stuff of "nobles and time-wasters who don't do honest work", was opposed to her receiving training, but her mother Iona wrote in secret to the House of Mysteries, one of the most renown schools of Arcana in the world.Though unhappy, Grier eventually agreed that Màiri's gifts needed honing. Her magic was uncontrolled by her own poor understanding of exactly what she was capable of. Untrained, she might even have been dangerous to have around. So she left Kelness and her family and started her residence in the House of Mysteries. The training was hard, particularly because some of the Senior Arcanists barely bothered to teach her, forcing her to learn a great deal on her own just to keep up. These teachers felt that a Dwarf from a poor family would never truly be capable of measuring up to other mages. Màiri intended to prove them wrong. She worked tirelessly, often falling asleep in the libraries and needing to be carried back to her bed.During one of these late library sessions in her second year, she met another student who was struggling. Zaia Aster was an Elf from a prominent magical family who was also struggling with the expectations of her teachers. In her case, they were impossibly high due to her family's fame. She and Màiri agreed to help each other, and after a great many long nights studying and practicing together, both realized that they had fallen in love.Sadly, fate intervened in their happiness two years later. Both had progressed in their studies to more than satisfactory levels, and were about to graduate to Junior Arcanists and be given field assignments. Days before the ceremony, a letter arrived from Zaia's parents. They had arranged a marriage for her, to a man from a house of great standing. All of Zaia's protests fell on deaf ears. The wedding would go ahead as planned. So Màiri was forced to part with her, but not before Zaia gave her an Elven sword and a promise that she would always love her. The graduation was a more somber affair than Màiri had expected, but the promise of getting to go out into the world as an official representative of the House of Mysteries lifted her spirits a little. She vowed that she would work harder than ever, that she would do her teachers, her family, and everyone else proud. And that one day, maybe, she and Zaia would meet again.

Crog was a typical pirate, enjoying his life manning the crow's nest, until the local navy caught up to their ship. The entire crew was slaughtered for their crimes - except Crog, who survived by hiding in the crow's nest during the fight. After the fight, Crog came down and helmed the now sinking ship amidst the corpses of his friends, getting it close enough to swim back to shore. Now unemployed and homeless, Crog meets a group of lawful adventurers who offer a new lease on life (and good moneymaking opportunity) so Crog can atone and help save the world. Using his longsword, intimidation, and bluff skills, Crog (who calls himself Captain now) will save the world whether they like it or not.

She was raised in a loving family. When she grew up, however, her family fell on hard times, and Aurelia decided to start pick-pocketing. After a year or so of this, her family's financial situation improved, but she still wanted to keep pick-pocketing. Eventually she fell in with some people who taught her the finer points of being a rogue, and she started adventuring full time.
Courtier
Sage
Outlander

Jada was a maid in the household of a local lord who abused, overtaxed, and generally oppressed the common people. He was known to take an ~interest~ in his female household staff, and he took an interest in late blooming Jada when she was 18. He essentially took advantage of her for 2 years, longer than any of his other victims. At 20, she took an interest in someone else. Two someone elses: a pair of siblings. The brother worked as a stablehand, the sister was a maid too, and Jada was pretty infatuated with the both of them, though she never acted on it. All the same, the lord took notice. Had them both quietly killed and showed Jada their bodies. That was the breaking point. She acted super docile and broken for the next week (which wasn't too difficult), all the while amping up rebellion among the rest of the household staff. Finally, one night, she goes to his room with the knife she uses to trim the candles. After, once he's asleep, she cuts his throat. There's some serious uproar, but because literally EVERYBODY hated this guy, including any of the guards who were recruited locally, there weren't too many subsequent casualties. She was hailed as the person who finally managed to kill the lord, and the community quickly rearranged itself into a less feudal structure. With the general population now even more protective of their hard won community, they established a sort of border defense. One old ranger recruited a bunch of young people, trained them, and stationed them at outposts along their borders. Jada was first in line. Now she lives at a ranger outpost, along with 2 others, protecting the border but also sometimes acting as a guide (and compulsively taking in wounded animals). One of those wounded animals became her companion: a panther who had taken some serious damage to his underbelly. She fixed him up, they bonded, and now he's her ride-or-die buddy. His name is Lysander.
Entertainer
disgraced bodyguard
Cloistered Scholar
Shop owner
He sought adventure across the sea!
Arch-enemy of a barbarian named Francis.
An escaped mind-slave of an illithid
Curator of all human knowledge, including everything forgotten.
Ex-pirate whore currently adventuring to keep his twin from dying
Her family were all bards. Sadly, Wren was tone deaf.
He creates new adventurers to accompany him on his own adventures
Grew up in a brothel where his mother was the Madam
Trained in secret mind-control magic by the MRA. Searching for new girls.
Sent on pilgrimage to contribute to the collective experience of the monastery
Soren is a farm boy turned folk hero who isn't very bright.
Noble who was cheated out of his family's fortress by his Uncle
Trained by a cultist sect, upon abandoning the cult they killed his family
After his former adventuring party died horribly, Eskey learned the value of teamwork.
Disgraced knight who slaughtered his hometown's duke in a duel over a woman.
Young widow who lost both children in accident related to her wizard husband's death.
A divorced, deadbeat dad with no life skills.  Shoots first and axes questions later.
Got stranded in Kara-Tur and was taught martial arts before finding his way back.
Alcoholic, cowardly, underachieving magic school dropout, 15 years older than her classmates. Loves awkward silence.
A sharpshooting jock with a bow who travels the countryside in search of glory and acclaim.
A reformed thief trying to turn his life around as an entertainer, despite barely restrained kleptomaniacal tendencies.
Oto is an over weight sage forced to leave his monastery due to over indulgence in spirits.
Middle son of noble family, pursuing advanced skill in the augmentation of weapons and tools with magic.
Angry teenager who sold his soul to the devil for the power to rescue his friends from danger.
Criminal/Highwayman. Retreated to the wilderness after exploding some innocent townspeople (Wild Magic Surge - you know the drill)
Former adventurer who lost his party against an evil wizard. Spend the last decades training to fight mages.
Protected his town from a monster and then went off in search of ways to help more people
Abandoned, he was raised on the borderlands. He stalks Giant-kind in his cloak Twilight, wielding his long sword Eveningstar.
Iron John was disillusioned with castle life and so took to the wilds to champion good and fight evil.
Born with powers over death, Jericho strives to learn about his gift and use it for the betterment of others
The Moon Pope excommunicated me and stole my gender because my hat was bigger than his, and I'm out for revenge.
Born and raised in the Shadowfell, death was a constant presence. Nico left to experience the gifts life has to offer.
His family was killed many years ago, but he recently learned his sister may have survived. He is currently searching for her whereabouts.
Rhea is a chaotic good cleric. She met and enchanted (without him being aware) the lawful good warrior, Noggin.  Together, they conquered the dungeon.
Raised by a merchant family and apprenticed to the thieves guild. Clarence eventually learnt he was better at making thigns dead than unlocking them.
With his wild magic he accidentally killed an agent of a barbarian tyrant. He fled the country and is now victim of an international manhunt
After the horrendous slaughter of his father, Charles vowed to hunt down and destroy every last Paladin until he could guarantee the safety for his family.
She was the daughter of a kichen wench and a soldier, brought up in a church compound and taught soldering and healing from an early age.
Outlander, growing up in the haunted forest, orphaned by werewolves. Moved to city, lived on the streets. Hired by the inquisitors of Thraben to stop a necromancer.
Formerly an ancient red dragon, he was cursed by a powerful wizard to be a handsome prince until he learns what it is to be a true hero.
Raised in the streets. Exposed to a font of dark magic which inscribed dark tattoos on his skin, allowing him to enhance his CQC and teleport (in lowlight conditions).
A sorcerer of humble beginnings; homeless as a child he started showing signs of magical aptitude, he was found by a mage and trained at the capital's mage academy.
A young Ernest Hemingway-type, Tera is a writer, bookworm, adventurer, big game hunter and a bit of a lush. She specializes in two-weapon fighting and her favored enemy is animals.
Disgraced illusionist who turned to blood magic to prove to his former mentor that he can and will surpass him and will become a God by manipulating life energy itself.
Singham comes from a family that includes several evil wizards, including his father. Singham is somewhat estranged from his family because he would like to be a not entirely evil wizard.
A milician who decided to serve the god of the forest against those who do it harm when he witnessed the forest near his hometown burned to the ground by orks.
Son of a corrupt merchant sets out with sword in hand to find his own way in the world and to perhaps, do some good.  As outlined in the following book.  https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008VO29DS
Faradan is a 17 year old human girl. She carries a quarterstaff and light armour. She emphatically does not wear a hat.She is a skilled magic user.I don't know much more about her.
Found by the party hidden under a bed in one of the rooms of the mage tower of a mad wizard, with no memory other than an immense rage and fear for wizardry.
She became terrified of the undead during her time at the convent. Her chosen form of ministry is to slay their kind while studying the secrets of necromancy to better combat the threat.
Formerly a clerk, Harwin used his retirement funds to study evil wizardry via a correspondence course. He's old, bitter, and intends to make everyone pay for the time he's spent being old and bitter.
He likes fighting and he likes a challenge. One day, he hopes to land a hit in a boxing match with a deity. Dress for the job you want, nit the one you have.
Robert and his fiancee are saving up to buy an inn and tavern of their very own. To that end, he works as a hireling, accompanying adventurers and performing menial tasks for reasonable pay.
Abused as a child got in a fight with his dad and killed him, took up his magical sword and went on to fight in any wars to get paid for and do some bodyguard jobs.

Marked by a cursed brand, an escaped slave must take down an infernal-led band of colonials and capitalists to save the continent from being taken by the powers of the abyss, and return power to his native people.
Ilun is a genderqueer nomad whose brother left their home many years ago. Rarely do people leave their tribe, and Ilun was very afraid to do it, but he wanted to know what had become of his brother.

Orphaned at a young age and raised by Aarackoan Monks. The monks ascended to another plane, leaving Erin with their blessings. Now, she seeks revenge on those who orphaned her by using the boons of her adopted parents.

An ex-guard, who became disillusioned with the law. Her job made her punish the poor and let the rich go free. One day she couldn't take the injustice any more and left to become a sword-for-hire, helping those in need.

Farmer - serflike upbringing, was taught to read by an elf that lived among them as the wise woman. Was placed in a household as a maid, but the resident magician noticed her skill and sent her packing to study under various masters.

Grew up on the streets and had to learn to survive. Now is a thief who also fights to make sure no one is wronged around him. Only person he truly trusts is his wolf Nox who has been with him for years.

A traveling performer who uses a magically enhanced instrument to spread the joy of music. They left home at a young age in order to remove any financial burden from their family. One day they hope to return, especially to see their older sister.

The second son of a noble family, he was dispossessed after they took the losing side in a rebellion against a despotic king.  After his brother's death in battle, he inherited the title, but was forced to flee with a family servant under assumed names.

A private detective whose last job landed him with an experimental space ship and instructions to keep it hidden until contacted. It's been ten years and he's finally received the message. "Come to my home planet. Bring the ship. I've been murdered. Found out why."

Knut was born on an aviary. His parents raised bees to sell honey to a Mead making operation of some significance. Knut was Jan's 3rd son, so while he did learn the family business, he knew he would not inherit and struck out on his own.

After her only child died in a blaze, Helen, a seamstress, became obsessed with mastering the art of fire magic. She is fascinated by flames and they are always her first resort when faced by any problem. Monster? Burn it with fire. Cold? Set fire to a tree.

Honorable daughter of Helvan Grayhold,  the commander who oversees Grayhold keep. Since her birth she has been groomed to succeed her father in his charge of keeping the invading horde from breaching the imperial states borders. A role that she has taken to with much pride and determination.

Sterling Leith made a deal with death. Well, somewhat. In order to achieve fame and fortune, she asked the Goddess of Death to grant her magical powers, but with great power comes great responsibility. She has to track and keep tabs on people who escaped death--EVEN her own party.

A low-ranking member of the royal family, Treylin went abroad to hone his skills as a soldier in order to protect his kingdom.  After many adventures, he came back home after a tragedy made his minor claim to the throne strong enough to be considered as a candidate for king.

Last survivor of a world destroyed by the forces of Entropy.  Was sent to his new world as a child with an innate magical sense.  He grew up as an orphan on the run from those forces and along the way attracted the attention of war lords, sorceres, and gods.

As a youth, was trained by the thieves' guild to steal aboard boats in the harbor to identify potential targets.  She was saved by a Sarenrite Pathfinder who brought her to the temple who later sent her to Absalom to join the Society, to spread the faith and to do good.

Varos was a soldier fighting in the borderlands between 2 kingdoms. The war was relatively small, but he was horrified by the disproportionate loss of life for "a few acres of trees and rocks". After he left military service, he decided to take up adventuring to fight for something good while he still had the strength.

A man whos rude to people who lack his commitment to hardwork and fair play, his passion is painting but its not enough to support his wife and child on the way so he works as a lumberjack on the side. He's no hero, but he is a big softie and VERY excited to have a kid

Maggie used to work on the docks. Then the union went on strike, and she was down on her luck. Her girlfriend Gina supported them by working at a tavern, but the bosses wouldn't agree to the strike demands. Maggie led a rebellion against the dock bosses, but then had to flee the town for her own, and Gina's safety.

Ilun was the foremost scholar on Cthulhu and the definitive expert in the field, and soon further study led to him beginning to tap into the eldritch magics surrounding the Elder Gods. This began to drive him insane, and the more power he got, the more he became convinced that he was the mortal incarnation of the Great Cthulhu itself.

Vivica is a sailor prone to obsession. She became involved in ocean worship many years ago, and more recently discovered her rituals could allow her to harness the power of deities beyond the imagination of most. Her tattoos shift on her skin sometimes. If she had friends they might know to read her emotions by them, but she does not have friends.

Protector and admirer of beauty and nature, Brune roamed the world searching for great natural beauty. One day he saved a sylvan elf child from brutal goblins. The goddess of the forest recognized his act and empowered him with a connection with nature and the powers of a paliden. He then came upon a burning village and began his epic valiant journey.

Local ambitious politician, patriot. Uses whatever means necessary to protect Sparrow’s Point (securing power is a secondary goal). Ranks in use magic device, and access to several wands, sending stones, etc.Has leverage over most of the city council, planning for the upcoming mayoral election (which is scheduled to be very soon) as the townsfolk almost always vote according to the council’s recommendation.

Grew up in a rogue temple. Saw her older brother get swallowed by terrifying sentient shadows. Picked off the streets to go to an elite fighters guild; failed out of training as a teenager due to a general lack of caring. Became a bouncer out of boredom; fell in love with a rogue and followed him into a life of heist crime.

Was part of militaristic feudal nation, bonded with his battalion of 5, went to Acheron to retrieve a powerful artifact for the nation, battalion and rest of army died / went mia, he deserted, he ran, now a hermit who has figured out what the powerful artifact is capable of and has reentered society in an attempt to keep it from mortal hands.

Antje was originally a small-time fencer of stolen goods. Her life changed when she acquired an old lyre that had once belonged to the mad hunchback Duke Aubrey. Entranced by the Note she heard when she plucked it, she swore allegiance to the Duke, who had risen to become an archfey, in exchange for revelations of mysteries that would take her far from her previous life.

orphaned at a young age when goblins attacked her family's farmstead, she ended up in the whorehouse to make a living but eventually found a place in a convent. Blessed by her god and an urge to run towards danger rather than away, she was soon sent out into the world with her Superior's blessings to make her own way, rid the world of evil and discover wonders.

Edith grew up in the stifling atmosphere of a small farming town in Plaguewrought Land. She dreamed of things bigger than a bleak future as a farm wife, so she went to college to study wizardry and archeology. Eventually, she became an adventurer, seeking to repatriate stolen artifacts, secure dangerous relics, and protection the material culture of all the peoples of Faeruûn.She has a tiefling fiancé her parents do not approve of.

Justin was born in the Kingdom of Aragorn, a successor kingdom to a realm that arose after a cataclysmic battle with evil at the center of the continent. Along with his companions Ragnar and Phocas, they encountered and were cursed by an artifact to become involuntary worldwalkers. Now, together, sometimes separate, they wander various Prime Material Planes and beyond, seeking a way to return to their home, having adventures along the way.

Kip was about 8 when he found a strange skull in his yard.  He always liked skulls, features, little natural treasures.  When he lifted this skull, though, he unknowingly awakened a long-died diety/entity, who offered him the power to speak to and tend to the dead, in exchange for fulfilling the diety's wishes.  Kip replied, as you would expect an 8-year old boy to do:  "Cool!"  And thus Kip became a death druid.

Essentially a third-rate thief for most of her life with a penchant for raiding dungeons and leaving unscathed, she met a rather large roadblock in her journey when she was affected by a Flesh to Stone spell from a trap.  She then spent hundreds of years, entirely conscious but unable to move, until some otherwise clueless people managed to figure out how to rescue her.  In thanks, she pledged her services to them.

Orphaned with his paladin twin brother at all young age, he took to the roads to earn a life performing cantrips for coin and passage. Upon arriving at his uncle Morty's tower, he and his twin parted ways as he learned the secrets of the arcane. Many years later, they reunited, protecting a town from a horde of savage raiders and in so doing, changed their opinion of necromancy and magic for the better.

Was training to be a wizard, when his greedy mentor opened a portal to the void.   A great being was visible through the portal. I dubbed it "The Wanting Maw" it came through the portal and swallowed my master. Upon my master's demise the portal closed but a giant tooth was left by the being, I grasped the Tooth and was instantly taken over with power, and the lust to gain more of it...

A woman who, after obtaining eternal life via strange and arcane methods, decided to afford herself a little extra protection by learning how to raise the dead.  Naturally this gave her quite a few enemies, and absolutely none of them were willing to show mercy to the kind of lady who had just committed such profane acts, so her worries were retroactively justified.  Travels the world with her thrall, who she pretends is her daughter, named Yorshka.

Orphaned at a young age. Never new his parents. Was friends with a kid who aspired to be a knight at the orphanage. Later Adopted by a 20 year old court mage to be trained as his pupil. Always felt distant to his adopted parents, but is very grateful for all they did for him. Wants to train in magic in order to fulfill his adoptive fathers goals, and help out in return for being given a home.

Old and forgotten, Edwin never went on any adventures because he was never "ready." His wife died recently, and though she told him to go on a goddamn adventure before he died, he has sat in his tower in a depressed haze, feeling that he is too old. Edwin missed his chance, but now, some adventurers have stumbled upon his doorstep. Edwin has nothing else to lose, and nothing else to live for, so now is the time. To adventure!

Kettel loves to cook and bake for friends and family and it shows despite her tiny frame. She lives with her companion of many years, a man who grows plants for their herbalist shop, though she has finally taken interest in a man for herself. Shy as she is and as most people assume she and her companion are together, it stayed quiet for a long time. After all, how often does one fall for the local blacksmith when he's half orc?

Ikia is a spy. She works as a banker's clerk but encodes secret messages into the ledgers, which are passed on to her handler in the capital city. She hates and fears him, but is totally devoted to him because he has her daughter captive. When the messenger carrying one of her ledgers was in a merchant caravan that was attacked, Ikia sets out after them with a party, but will not hesitate to betray them the moment her handler asks her to.

Acolyte who studied the beliefs, rituals, and history of a religion that disbanded when their "Goddess of Strength, Frost, and the Moon" was killed along with the destruction of this world's moon. Devoted herself to a small number of the Goddesses dictates only to discover she was growing an ability with frost magic. Believing this "Kaoyr, Goddess of the Moon" may still exist in some form and channeling divine magic through her, Milan devoted herself to knighthood and became a paladin of this fallen god.

The sixth son of a noble family, Suthra was promised to the High Church and he joined its militant wing as fit his temperament. However his lessons took very well and while he was vested as a Paladin, he refused to swear to uphold the state for it did not always uphold divine law. As a result, he was exiled for fear that others would realize there was no divine punishment upon him for his refusal to uphold the lie of high priest and noble alike.

Martin grew up in a rural family and, after showing promise as a wizard, was sponsored to attend Iradin University. There he studied both magic and ecological anthropology, in the course of which he did field expeditions with tribes of phanatons, centaurs, and gnomes in the Grey Ridge region. He then answered a call for adventurers of good character to serve as envoys from a court of the Elven Holy Corellon Federation to a local tribe of kobolds that had been converted to the worship of Bahamut.

A woman who was thoroughly ejected from virtually all forms of "proper" magical academia for her strange and outlandish theories.  You see, she believed that the common slime had magical properties far beyond every other race, and secretly held the secret to eternal life.  Seeing as nobody wanted to deal with this crazy woman shouting about it, they kicked her out and exiled her as an unapproved witch.  So she went to the swamps at the edge of civilization and continued to poke at slimes with sticks.

As a the second son of the king, Nomyn Dreth grew up never expecting the throne.  Instead, he joined the army, and led an elite special forces unit.  That changed when his older brother was killed under suspicious circumstances, and he was framed for the deed.  His father, unwilling to kill his only remaining son, instead exiled him from the land.  He now wanders as an adventurer, attempting to gain coin and status such that he might one day return to his home, and claim his birthright.

Hygar's life as a motley warrior was shaped at an early age when his village was attacked by goblins, murdering most and enslaving the few survivors. He spent his adolescence in the company of rogues, grifters and scum of all kinds. He took the last name of the crooked wizard who led the attacks that took his family from him. When he survived the Pits of Hwagh at fifteen, he murdered his nemesis and made it his life's goal to snuff out evil and exploitation in all its forms.

Muzg Shon was the third son of the famous merchant/banker Aten Shon.  Famous because he could get anyone and everyone to pay up (catchphrase: everyone eventually pays Aten Shon). His brothers adopted a likewise forceful personality. With such overwhelming personalities around him, he became retiring and quiet, and eventually studied the ways of the shadow dancers. He has struck out into the world to make his fortune, enough to command the attention and respect of his father and older brothers. He hides as a matter of practice and reflex.

Uric was a member of the Red Sands tribe. While accompanying a trade caravaan to the city, Uric was attacked by bandits. They stole the trade goods, and Uric set off to retrieve them. Once he tracked them down to a nearby port, Uric dealt justice to them befitting his tribe. Once he did so, he was arrested by the town guards and put in jail. Due to him killing bandits, Uric was given leniency and allowed freedom in return for becoming a bounty hunter a la Suicide Squad.

Pumpkin was a child of poor goatherds. Unable to support her, her parents turned her over to the martial arts masters at a secluded monastery to be raised. After she reached adulthood, one of her instructors stole a sacred kung fu manual from the monastery's library, then fled, intending to sell it to some evil power. The abbot of the monastery has charged Pumpkin to go out into the world and recover the sacred manual. To do so, she must find her old teacher and defeat him in single combat.

Theresia was raised by nuns in a convent orphanage. She became a fierce believer, and when she was old enough, she joined the same convent as a novice. As a nun, she worked in the same orphanage where she grew up -- until it was attacked by cultists and, in the defense of her charges, she took up arms and felt the power of Lothian flow through her. After that night (and some long conversations with her mother superior), she left the convent and entered Lothian's service as a paladin.

Akedia was born to a pair of archaeologists and tomb raiders, and spent more time in dungeons than above-ground. Although his mother was killed shortly after he was born by a spiteful ex-lover, her ghost stuck around to help raise him and from this he's gained a knack for sensing and communicating with the undead. Eventually, he took his mother's whip and his father's legendary hot pants and struck out on his own to discover and plunder a lost ruin of his own, as is tradition in the Megido family.

Diplomatic mission from Kara-Tur passed through his village, one of the diplomats, master of an ancient magical-martial art, noticed the potential dwelling within a young boy of that village. He split off from the diplomats to stay and tutor the boy. A few years later, well-versed in the arts and philosophy of the Path of the Blade, the now-a-young-man swore an oath, becoming a hexblade. To signify the change in his life, he abandoned his old name and his master, just before returning to Kara-Tur, bestowed upon him a new one: Jin.

My family is no stranger to wealth, power, and privilege. In the glory days of Neverwinter, my parents were the count and countess of Corlinn Hill, a large estate located in the hills northeast of the city. But Mount Hotenow erupted thirty years ago, devastating Neverwinter and erasing Corlinn Hill from the map. Instead of growing up on an estate, I was raised in a small but comfortable town house in Waterdeep. As an adult, I stand to inherit a meaningless title and little else. My personal goal is to civilise Phandelen.

Regan Hart is the world's most beloved travelling entertainer. Her band, Regan Hart and the Moonlighters, tour the realms, bringing joy and a good song to everyone they meet. But Regan has.... other motives. You see, Regan is a kleptomaniac, and can never resist a good steal. It turns out entertaining is a really easy way to take shit from people, and the better she is at music, the better gigs she gets, the better stuff she gets to steal. So she continues on her merry way, taking everything her gay little hands can carry.

Lihrah was born a noble Illuskan to the far north-west of the world however has lived as a hermit for the past 7 years of her life. She does not talk of her past to anyone. Her parents wished to harness the power of The Gold Dragon Aurunvost which Lihrah fought against, eventually freeing the dragon herself and in return was granted its power. She abandoned her position as a noble and fled to the wilderness where she learnt more about her powers and how to fend for herself. She studies dragons to understand her power further.

Raised as a traveling merchant of Potions, notions, and other wares Basha is an excellent salesman. He could sell Ice to a frost giant. He was renouined among the family for enchanting small trinkets with illusionary traits and selling them a magical. They would work a town for a few weeks and then wonder off to the next village. This worked well until while hunting for new wares before ditching town, he was captured by slave traders from the underdark. He managed to get free of his shackles, but leaving the Underdark has been a daunting task.

Character's class (rogue, wizard, cleric: Monk, Way of the open hand
Character's backstory: He lives life as pious as he can. He lived in the monastery Seigi no Shudoin from the time he was about two until he left to aid the people of the world by teaching them his skills. He wears the blindfold he was given when he entered the monastery to test his resolve. His harsh sense of justice gets him into unfortunate situations, but he always manages to hit his way out with his quarterstaff. Above all, Li is loyal. If his friend should fall in battle, he won't rest until justice has been delivered with an iron hand

A poor, but beautiful gymnast, Sally married a rich man with the intent of being a trophy wife. As the reality of being a rich woman sank in, Sally decided to alleviate her boredom by learning magick. Soon the temptation to become a necromancer took hold. After accidentally killing a local farmers with a spell, Sally realized that her boredom could only be lessened through killing. Killing randomly seemed stupid though, so she figured she'd just join up with some adventurers, because those folks always seem to be finding themselves in situations where killing was the only option. Also, this chick totally fucks.

He and his family were driven into the Underdark by misunderstanding villagers for worshipping Wee Jas, a goddess of death. They lived peacefully there for a few years, before his family succumbed to an illness. Tyvo was, obviously, saddened by their passing, but he was at peace with it, as they were with Wee Jas now, away from the pain of their sickness. But when Demon Lords arose in the Underdark, his family arose as undead. Tyvo set out as an adventurer to put his family back to their just rest, and to help drive the Demon Lords back to where they belong.

Nathaniel was a spoiled chaos deity that ruled over the chaotic realm in the afterlife. As a troublemaker and a prankster who would do just about anything to get out of work, he took things too far one day by embarrassing his uncle in front of other ethereal dignitaries. in retaliation his uncle cursed him to be trapped in a human form. Fortunately he could still access some of his abilities as a spell caster, and he uses his abilities to advance his party member's goals in the hopes that one day he can find a spell to release him from this curse!

Left on the doorstep of the temple of Ilmater in Baldur's Gate due to her strange appearance with patches of red dragon-like scales and golden eyes, she was raised as an Acolyte. As she grew up, she found that she had an affinity for and love of fire, and the ability to instinctively cast simple fire magic. She quickly discovered that this was more dangerous than helpful.After years of attending to the needs of the temple and learning to control her pyromania and desire to hoard gold, she has been sent out into the world to gain life experience and grow as a person.

Ramdao lived a fairly mundane life, and he joined a monastery at the age of 18 after being unsure of what he wanted to do with his life after falling to get into bard college. This particular monastery dedicated itself to The Way of the Wandering Fist, a discipline based on the pursuit of wisdom through experience gained through adventure and travel, which was perfect for the restless Ramdao to be able to head out and find his own way in the world. After about 7 years of training and journeying, he would run into the first couple members of his current venturing party.

Seus was born in Cheliax, where his keen intellect was realized by his mentors, who accepted him as their patron to learn the Arcane Arts. He excelled at learning from magical texts, but sought to do more with his life. When pressured by his patrons to give allegiance to Asmodeus, Seus left his homeland in search of intellectual freedom, new experience, but most of all freedom of choice.  His time in the Stolen Lands has taught him that knowledge is not the only thing he must develop to survive.  Only after everything is done, does the journey then become finding out what else to do.

(This is a "Night's Black Agents" character, rather than DnD)A former Commando de Penfentenyo with skills in small boat operations, infiltration and naval cqb.He has been deployed in Somalia for anti piracy work prior to leaving the Beret Verts but has a wide history of international deployment.Born in Kaolack Senegal, he moved to France with his mother in 1982 after his father was killed resisting the 1981 Coup against Gambian president Jawara.Character, Gregarious, French, Lots of languages, good with networking and very very good with boats, diving gear and close quarter small arms combat.French, English, Wolof, Mandinka, ArabicEats Peanuts, like… all the time.Hometown Auray in Breton

Gadbee is the son of a nobleman who preferred the lute than his family's heritage. When his father started having liaisons with the King in secret, the history of his family's lineage as spymasters and assassins was made all too clear. Gadbee then stole the family heirloom; a magic lute that would allow one to cast spells if they knew what to play, and as a Tennor, he was taught early on what to play. Escaping the life of bloodied hands, Gadbee lives a pacifist life of merriment and is happy to charm his way into someone's generous pockets if he needs a little more coin.

The son of a succubus and a human mercenary, Vertok grew up in war camps and among violent men. During the breaking of a siege his father's company was hired to hold off, he was rounded up with other mercenaries and ended up trained in gladiatorial combat. However on the cusp of earning enough money to start a life outside of the arena, it was discovered that his prowess in combat came in part from his demonic heritage and the invocations that it allowed him to wield. Imprisoned for his conduct, he met up with others to pivot his life to one of freedom and adventure.

Ash "Don't call me Ashley" Fronk grew up the only heir to the Fronk Banking dynasty. As a boy, the lack of care and attention from his aristocratic parents drove him to act out in more and more dramatic ways, developing his skills as a confidence artist and performer. As a young man, his inability to mesh with polite society and a penchant for reckless behavior wreaked havoc on his family's reputation and bank account. At 20 years old, Ashley was cut off. He now sets out to make his own name and fortune, armed only with the flintlock pistol he lifted from his father's coat.

Breenie is a charlatan by trade. She was raised and trained by her mentor. They later had a falling out over particulars Breenie can't remember, but she has a strong impression of repulsion and fear. She has short-term memory loss that seems to only be getting worse as the years go on. Every new identity she builds and plays is all the easier because she can easily forget that her lie isn't the truth. her skirts are full of pockets stuffed with junk and trinkets and she hides snacks in her tunic. She's young, pretty, and hare-brained and is destined to be a mad hermit, I'm sure.

Born in a small village in the foothills of the Sundered Ranges, Durn had a carefree childhood tending the crops and livestock of her community. Developing into a tall, rangy lass, she was on the cusp of womanhood when, one terrible night, a band of roving orks descended on her homestead. Durnhilda was tasked with tending the livestock in the High Forest the night they came. Howling in their bloodlust, the slaughtered young and old, man and woman alike. Durnhilda , seeing the smoke rising  from the burning hovels, returned to find her clan destroyed. Devastated with her loss, she took up her father's sword and pledged revenge.

Many years ago, Darlington Rose was tracking an criminal named Big Buck Stanton. Rose found Stanton and his gang out in the desert by a strange circle of stones. After a short shoot out, Stanton called to Rose to stand down. He did. Then Stanton explained to Rose that him and his gang were protecting something important and that they were casting a spell to take them far away. He proposed to Rose that if he let them go, it would be worth his while. Darlington agreed. He returned to town. "Stanton has been dealt with." He was held up as a hero, regardless if he wanted to or not.

Shurban was born with great potential. The elders say that a 2 headed goat was born the same night, and this was a sign of great portent. It was a great honor to be taken from his family and brought to serve the shaman, who raised the boy to be learned in tribal ritual, herbal medicine and natural magic. The sitting shaman always keeps some of the tribe's youth, of varied age, to train as his replacements. When coming of age, each is sent off into the world to seek knowledge and power, knowing that they could be called upon at any time to return and assume the shaman's mantle.

Having shaken off the debris of slum-life in a coastal city, D'leez finds the quiet and openness of the wilderness to be liberating. Here, beneath the open sky, he is free to make his own story without the interference of guilds or laws - each of which impose their own controls. But the road is often lonely and he adopts or recruits often, growing the ranks of his company of brigands - the Painted Blades. Each day they wake, apply heavy foundation and garish eyeshadow, and ride off to find merchants to raid or purses to lighten. The Painted Blades are universally feared and D'leez is the man behind the makeup.

He grew up on a farm, making ends meet harvest to harvest, his day-to-day existence a constant blur of early mornings, endless chores and unappetizing but economical meals; some days, if he was lucky, he got to try to draw a new letter on a fucking slate: wheeeeeeee. At last the boy said, "fuck this," and stole off in the night to make his way to Civilization, which he soon found was not better than the farm, necessarily, just differently bad. But it was in this crucible that his talents finally emerged, those talents being 1) being where he wasn't supposed to be and 2) taking what he wasn't supposed to have.

Bel was a soldier in the ranks of a minor nobles army. Prone to carousing he overdid it one eve and fell asleep while it was his watch , resulting in the slaughter of his fellows by a band or orcs. Fleeing into a nearby wood Bel came upon an ancient ruin of a temple dedicated to Helm , there he was somehow hidden from his  persuers even though they were all about. Bel interpreted this as a Blessing from helm and a second chance to do something with his life. He made his way to the nearest town and presented himself as a servant of the light at the temple of Helm..

Vladislav was bitten by a wereraven at an early age, and was kept in isolation. He found company in books, knowledge, and studying magic. Years later an old wizard traveler came to his town, looking for magicians to help take down the evil ruler of this land. Vladislav volunteered hoping to learn more from the wizard, but in the ensuing battle, he was gusted away to safety by the wizard, and lost all of his memories. Vladislav found a new identity as Sir House while living with other outcast wereravens, hiding the face he doesn't recognize behind a mask. He pursues knowledge and helping others with his knowledge, if only to tell them "You're Welcome."

Frank had always wanted to be a wizard, but coming from a nomadic barbarian tribe, and lacking the necessary intelligence, it wasn't meant to be. Until one day Frank, now older and participation on his own adventures, was visited by a nice man of the woods, human of face and torso, but the feet of a goat. This creature told Frank that he know someone who could make Frank a powerful wizard, and Frank was interested. So the two of them traveled deep into the woods where Frank, blissfully unaware of the consequences, made a pact with an Archfey spirit, starting his new life as a Warlock. Yet to Frank he is simply a great wizard.

Houg has spent his entire life within the sanctuary hidden within the deepwing mountains. As he wandered the mountainside as a child, he came across a falcon, injured gravely and with a broken wing. Not knowing what to do, he, after being scratched to hell and bitten by it, brought the falcon back to the sanctuary, and learned to care for it. With guidance from the elders, he slowly brought the falcon back to health, and watched it take off, wing restored. The vision of the bird leaving the sanctuary is Houg's most vivid memory.Now an adult, Houg seeks the freedom the healed bird possessed, and is venturing out into the world, hoping to someday find it again.

Betrayed by people close to him, Buridan fell from a promising career in the military to a secluded prison. For 5 years he did nothing but burn with revenge, then he met an elderly priest of Woedica in the cell beside his. The following 10 years were spent learning theology, particularly about the unjust revolution of the gods, and Woedica's destiny to return to the throne that was stolen from her. The priest eventually died of disease, and soon after Buridan was mysteriously released. He adopted the title of "Hjelthaer:" one who has been wronged and seeks retribution. He now wanders, earning influence for Woedica through great acts, and works to uncover the conspiracy that had betrayed him.

Yvette was a combat medic in the Third War. The sights she saw were gruesome and terrible, and jaded her to empathize less and less with those she saved. She couldn't sleep, and spent night after night trying to distract herself with studying the arcane. The few hours she found sleep were fitful and filled with dreams of obscure arcane prophesy, leading to a perpetually peeved practitioner. When she felt she had learned all she could in the libraries of her home town, Yvette set off to increase her knowledge of everything magical the old world and the new could offer. Little did she know the true power of her dreams, and how they would shape her entire life.

A craggy faced man fashioned of big bones and just a touch more weight than muscle, this is what they had in mind when the phrase “barrel chested” was first used.  Third son and older brother to James Argentaria, Amadeus was somewhat of a disappointment to his parents, never quite understanding the cut throat world of business, too soft hearted, and distracted by church to boot.  Cursed with a higher calling his father said.  Amadeus joined the ranks of the clergy and never looked back, an adequate scholar and a young man of palpable faith, amadeus’ husky form resulted in him being selected for training in the martial ranks of Chaplain, spiritual advisors to the Dukes knights, squires and soldiers.

Second son of the Duke of Esterel, Ferdinand never expected to inherit. He spent his time riding and hunting, and paid little attention to his studies. But when his brother died in mysterious circumstances in a neighbouring dukedom, he found himself unprepared for his increased importance. When his father died not long afterwards, Ferdinand's claim to the throne was challenged by his uncle. He used his connections in the army to seize power, imprisoning Ferdinand's mother and branding the boy a traitor in his absence. With only his father's sword to prove his claim to the dukedom, Ferdinand set off to find allies in a kingdom near Esterel, to discover who had killed his brother and to retake the throne.

Orphaned on the streets of a brutal city at the age of 4, Yelena grew up as a ward of the Thieves' Guild, scamming tourists and ordinary folk with her best friend. When she came of age, she left the Thieves' Guild to work for a local strongman, Markos Fanakati. Markos manipulated Yelena into abandoning all her old friends, and she believed he was her only real family. Then, in order to settle a debt with a dwarf gang, he told them she was a traitor and that they could have her head. Yelena barely escaped them with her life, and wandered the land for a year before ending up in the capital city of the land, where our story began.

Born from a peasant family, but in this family every seventh son of the seventh son is destined to be a great warrior who saves their town when a threat presents itself and goes on to be a benevolent hero. Mira is the seventh child of the seventh child, but is not a son, so her large family of mostly men doesn't believe she is destined to be a hero. A threat came eventually in the form of a Wyvern, but Mira fell in battle. Revived by her father, she was berated and stripped of her job at the family smithery to instead be a herder. She took some armor and weapons and snuck out that night, determined to prove herself.

Aysel was born in Barovia to a Vistani family. However, eventually her family had enough of Barovia's horrors and secretly left, taking a very young Aysel with them. They wandered Faerun for a time before settling at Luskan. Unfortunately Luskan was a crime ridden town, which soon claimed her father's life. Aysel found herself at home among the ranks of the Moon Bones, a guild of former criminals who sought to bring justice to Luskan with their criminal talents as detectives. She picked up on their skills quickly, though the work was dangerous. Eventually she made a critical mistake in a mission, which led to her home being destroyed, her mother killed. With that, she took off in search of the killer.

Theresa grew up in a noble setting. Her family was known for their wealth and power. What the people didn't see, however, was the fraud, lying, and making deals with bad people to keep that power. No one outside of the family and the servants knew this and lived to tell the world. Theresa hated this. After years of watching her family make others suffer, she decided to run away, only taking a few weapons to defend herself with. At just 15, she began living in the streets, and learning the way of the rouge. She vowed never to lie, and to always help those who had lost things because they were lied to, especially those who were done wrong by her family.

Dzimm (pronounced 'Jim') is a 6'4" muscular woman raised by dwarves. She identifies as a dwarf despite her human heritage, and is baffled when people do not treat her as oneThe low ceilings in the mines gave her multiple concussions while growing up, so she is not very clever at all - but she is very enthusiastic in everything she does, be it drinking ales, swinging her greatsword Barrington at goblins, singing dwarven songs or crafting bagpipes out of animal corpses. Her alignment is best described as 'chaotic good intentions', with her low intelligence often causing her not to realise why the consequences of her actions might be bad. But, steered by more intelligent teammates, she could become a fearsome and noble hero.

Lisbeth Walpurgis grew up as Thomas Wilhelm Walpurgis in the Barony of Willowdale, which is located out in The Wilds of the Empire of the Sun. She always knew that something wasn't quite right, but she finally realized that she was a trans woman when she hit her teens. Most of her family was accepting, but her father, owner of a trading company, did not approve. He had planned to pass the company on to his "son" and Thomas, now Lisbeth, wanted no part of it. Relations with her family became strained, and Lisbeth left the barony in order to pursue a life in The Wilds, hunting monsters and guiding travelers and caravans through the untamed and ever-changing lands that surround the Inner Empire.

Another Night's Black Agents Character22, EnglishSam was recruited young by the security services after being caught taking apart a surveillance drone. Sam wasn't trying to disable the drone, but needed the parts for a project. When interrogated by the Security services sam genuinely couldn't understand what was wrong. Sam worked for them for a while before getting bored and casually wandering out, under the eyes of the best surveillance tech in britain.Sam is the kind of person who would notice a 0.1V change on a power line, but trip over the stabbed guy on the floor in front of them. *Gender note: Sam's gender is undefined. She/He is slim and androgynous and when the subject of gender comes up he/she will evade it, or not understand it.

Eric used to work on centrain magical university as chief astronomer and astrologist. That's hat he remembers. He also remebers that he saw something terrible in the stars that is bound to happen. It was something so terrible he decided he needed a drink. Two year later, he found himself without a penny, outside a tavern, not remembering his last name, or where he comes from. However he found out he doesn't feel good then the watch comes around, and he is well known in all tavern and inns in the country. How that came to be, he is not sure. He joined the current party partly because of the cash, and partly because...well, they seemed like young fools to him, so he decided to look after them.

Raised in the backwater, Adila was eventually given to the temple after flooding destroyed her parents' fields and they couldn't afford to feed her. There, she excelled at the arts and music, until she was hand selected for the government orchestra. She rose quickly in prominence, and moved on to private performance and espionage for a Duchess. She spied and played until her closest friend betrayed her and pinned a magical crime on her. Her career was only saved by the good graces of a mysterious benefactor who ensured she was given the role of Lorekeeper at the Wizard school. Not unimportant, but certainly lacking the prestige and political influence of a court ensemble performer. She is striving to clear her name and return to her former power.

A tobacco-spitting evangelical snake-handler from the plains, Klaetus jovially invites any who wish to feel exalted accept the bitter sacrament of venom from his hand. In a former life, Klaetus traveled village to village with his parents while demonstrating the pristine and unsullied glory hidden in the poison, blessing those who endured the fever and illness with insight. So prepared, Klaetus wades into combat with a pair of trained asps wrapped around his arms which he so employs to pass divine judgement on his foes. As a boy, though, it was challenging for Klaetus to find and retain friends for very long, such was the demand of travel. When he does find a friend, his loyalty is as a perfect as the white hot venom he endures each day.

Some people run away to sea. Mag ran away to land. The early part of her life was spent aboard the corsair The Red Wyvern, a mercenary/pirate ship. For a time, life was grand. Merchant ships were plundered, coastal towns "encouraged" to give up supplies. By-and-large the crew of the Wyvern were not especially blood-thirsty - they didn't kill if it wasn't necessary, and preferred to rely on their violent reputation rather than actual violence. But eventually, a more cut-throat captain seized power. A captain who enjoyed the bloodshed as much as the profits (and kept a little too much of the profits for himself). And so Mag decided that her life on the ocean was over, for now, and she would head inland to seek her fortune on solid ground...

Born into nobility, Arden grew up learning how he were responsible for the peasants. When he first manifested his powers it were a happy time for hos family, it meant that Arden could take the family power to new heights. But when he also manifested the potential to controll the divine magics at will. When this knowlege reached the church, he were branded as a heretic. The divine magic should be the property of the gods and their followers. Unable to be a proper heir to his family Arden left. His purpose to ruin the church responisble, and the best way to do so, is to make its follower worship him instead. Afterall his magic is the sign that he might be a god in human form. The peasants will never know the difference....

Second Son of a wealthy merchant family, he was to be inducted into the Platinum Order to serve as a knight and then return with his experience to be the warmaster of the house. During his vigil in the forest of the lady he was tempted by a nymph and absconded with her in passionate romance that led him into the faewild and from there he was taken to the winter court to be inducted in the way of their Queen, the lady of darkness and ice, and while he spent years at court only a few weeks passed on the material plane. When he returned to the world and understood his errors he set out into the world to prove himself correct instead of turning to face the judgement of his mother for failing his vigil.

Vilina was the daughter of a minor duke. She grew up accustomed to being the most important person in her region, as the towns and farms would become her responsibility to lead and protect. Though no one ever told her to her face, she always knew she was neither smart nor beautiful. She tried hard. She studied for hours each day, learned gracefulness and the lady's arts from her mother, but knew that she would be a mediocre leader at best. But on the eve of her sixteenth birthday, a horde of barbarians ravaged the manor and slaughtered everyone. She took refuge in a basement storeroom with a single maid. Afterward, she took up her younger brother's armor and the family's legendary battleaxe and aet out, vowing she would not allow any barbarian to meet her and live.

Julia used to be a fairly normal, if spoiled, child. Her family's wealth and prestige combined with her parents' inability to actually parent meant she got almost anything she wanted. However, there was one thing her parents kept forbidden: she was to never enter the reading room on the third floor of the west wing. Needless to say, she entered. Inside, she found a shriveled and withered corpse surrounded by the ashes of burned books. However, one book had managed to partially escape the flames. She picked it up, and then she was his. A ghost appeared before her, claiming to be her grandfather, and promised her whatever she wanted if she would just help him return to the land of the living. Now, she searches for arcane tomes, hoping that one will contain the knowledge she seeks.

She fled a bad home at a very young age, working various low-reputation jobs and barely managing to afford a roof over her head. Struggling to survive, it didn't help that she had frequent nightmares that sometimes turned into waking visions, usually of terrible events in far-off places that she had no possible chance to prevent. Ignorant of her past lives, she didn't recognize Apollo when he appeared to her as a man, whispering her true name and impregnating her with his child. Mika was her shining light, her one source of pure joy amongst the cruelty of the world and the madness that lived within her own mind. They cared for each other, through truthfully Cassandra struggled more often than not, some days only barely hanging onto lucidity, some days drowning the visions in strong drink and stronger potions.

Sa'ar was a no-good thief, in his home city, and was on the chopping block to be executed. The city he lived in was dedicated to the God of Trickery, who opposed laws, and Sa'ar ruminated in his final moments about how ridiculous it is to be condemned to death for breaking a law in a city dedicated to lawlessness.The next thing Sa'ar knew, HE was holding the Executioners Axe, and standing over the form of the former Executioner. Everyone around, Sa'ar included, saw this as a holy sign from their God, that Sa'ar was chosen as a servant of chaos.Sa'ar slew everyone who had condemned him to die, and left the city on a pilgrimage to the other temples of his God. He had dedicated his everything to his God, and would see the world of Laws torn down.

Born to a powerful and wealthy family in the great city of Waterdeep, she went with her parents to visit another town when she was only 3. Being her first time outside the city and amongst nature, she was enchanted by it and wandered off one night. She stumbled through a fey crossing and found herself hopelessly lost. After wandering for about a day, she happened upon two old elven planewalker women who were native to the Material Plane. They took her under their wing and into their home in the upper end of the expansive High Forest. They taught her their ways of naturalism and the arcane, and after they passed she took the role of protector of the upper High Forest at 16. She also made contact with a nearby town and does arcane favors for its citizens.

Raised in a nomadic clan of humans and orcs and taught that Betrayal, in all its forms, is the greatest and only sin, he was devastated when a splinter group of the clan staged a coup and caused a complete regime change. He was even more devastated when all the children, and his only remaining relative, his little sister, were taken by the new leaders to be forced to do labour, as slaves. "To toughen the lil' bastards up."__Strength is there to protect the weak, and so a reserve was discovered within him. Pure unrivalled rage. But it was not enough. He tried to fight when they came, but he was struck down. And the leader's disdain for him saved him, they carved deep cuts into his face, torso, and arms, and left him to bleed out.__Needless to say, he didn't.

Born with thews larger than his head, Thewnar strangled his first ox at the age of four. As puberty dawned, his skin began to secrete a viscous oil, gaining him the sobriquet "Thewnar the Ever-glistening". He was renowned far and wide for his strength, and he became an apprentice to the local woodcutter, eschewing axes in favour of simply tearing the logs apart with his bare hands. Alas, his peaceful existence was not to last. When he was only fourteen years old, a marauding band of bandits attacked his village, razing it to the ground. Thewnar, vowing revenge, hunted down the bandits. When he found them, he dismembered the members of their band by hand. As the last bandit died, Thewnar read in his scattered entrails (the bandit's entrails, not Thewnar's, his entrails were fine) an omen...Thus began Thewnar's quest for revenge!

Debonair rogue and philanderer Guillermo got a taste for the ladies young, it was a desire that never went away. Young or old each woman is a gem with their own mysteries and beauty to be treasured. Guillermo grew up in a wealthy merchant family (Argentaria) that married into nobility (Aunt Isy). Despite Guillermo’s anti-classism he thrives on the fringes of noble society, where there are ladies aplenty, some in unfulfilled arranged marriages that are looking for a discrete cicisbeo others unmarried that are looking for a walk on the wild side without the risk of an infatuated lover ruining their future marriage prospects. That they are invariably wealthy does not hurt. Barely tolerated by the noble males it is Guillermo’s reputation as a duellist (and having killed a man in duel) that has stayed many a hand, that and some powerful patronesses.

Raised in a tavern, adored by her parents and three brothers, she was the baby not only of the family, but also of the inns regulars. She led a charmed life, she’d always felt like there was someone else looking out for her, guiding her steps. She had always known that she was waiting for something, a sign.One hazy summer evening, whilst she was helping her mother serve drinks in the inn she overheard some strangers talking of “the path of Ashakris”, a name unknown to her but immediately something resonated within her, this was it! The learnt that there was a small sect devoted to following Ashakris, the goodness of suffering and renewal, in the far off city of Phyris.Three weeks later with the blessing of her bemused and worried parents she set off with her pony Yuna, her first steps on her path to become a blood mage…

Cursed as a child to turn into a swan every night from sunset to sunrise, she was protected not only as a princess, but also because of her weakened nighttime state. Tutored in literature, music, calligraphy, languages, and some maths and sciences, her true skill blossomed under the tutelage of the court high priest. With an affinity for light spells, she learned to channel magic from the gods, though she can't cast any while in the form of a swan. It took all of her skill in persuasion to convince her parents to allow her to travel to perform her diplomatic duties, promising to always stay with her retainers and keep her curse a secret. Truthfully, she does wish to make connections with foreign governments and increase her kingdom's reputation, but she also has been searching for a cure to her condition, hopefully before her parents try to marry her off.

Having adventured a little in his youth, then spent some odd decades as a librarian at a wizard's college, Benny has since retired to live a quiet life with his grandson, Roman, and a few old friends. He shares an apartment with Margaret, a wiry old woman nearly as old as he is, and lives next door to a witch named Gothel, who generally doesn't like men but finds Benny agreeable enough. He misses helping out students, and has something of an open-door policy with the nearby magic school, always ready and willing to lend an ear, or a book, or a quick escape portal, provided they help him draw out the runes for a magic circle. His hands don't work very well anymore, and he walks and talks about as slow as one might expect for a human his age, but he's unfailingly optimistic and always has a kind word for everyone.

Ara is the bastard daughter of the female chieftain of her tribe. Her younger half-brother, jealous of the eldest's inheritance, got into some dark magic. The oldest brother/heir and Chieftain were concerned but the youngest brother convinced Ara to have them all sit down together to talk things out, except by "talk" he actually meant "kill the heir and use his blood to put my cool new demon familiar in Mom". Ara killed the youngest brother and her demon-possessed mother before the demon could fully take her over, and barely escaped with her life since her tribe assumed she killed the chieftain and the two heirs out of jealousy. Now she mostly prefers to keep her head down and let others make decisions since she is clearly bad at that; though sometimes a little arrogance of But I'm the Chief's Daughter still creeps in when she's not being careful to be annoyingly obsequious.

Emerich was born to a rich noble family, who made there money off of giving adventurers gear for the Abyss, in return for a portion of the treasure. His parents gave him the best tutors in many subjects, and even a famous rogue taught him knife skills, which Emerich used for hunting. Soon, his parents died. His siblings squabbled to take the lead of the family. However, unknown to him, his family took peasants from the Southern section of Terrace and put them to work, making custom adventurers gear, treating them like slaves. Soon, as the peasants learned about the weakness, there was an uprising. The peasants needed help, and the contacted Emerich. Emerich agreed to help them, and the uprising occurred. Deferring from the plan, the peasant force killed all of Emerich's siblings. Emerich was struck with guilt and anger. He needed to disappear. He took the name Gustave, and went to go into the Abyss.

Jorma was found as an infant floating in the ocean by a group of fisherman after a storm that killed his parents and destroyed their boat.
